commits.message:
Fix svc: Drop frame is earlier than current keyframe (#2196)

* Fix svc: Drop frame is earlier than current keyframe

* Log detail of dependencydescriptor

Disable h264 for android firefox (#2190)

* Disable H.264 for android firefox

* Fix syntax error for rule

* lower case

* Remove disabled codec from AddTrackRequest

* Consistent handling of enabled codecs

Mainly cleaning up where we are doing codec filtering.

There's also behavior change of how we handle codec compatibility. If a client doesn't support the client's desired codec, we'll pick a backup automatically
instead of rejecting the client's request.

Requires an update on multi-codec simulcast handling.

* fix alternative codec selection

---------

Co-authored-by: David Zhao <dz@livekit.io>

Do server PLI when sync is required. (#2197)

* Do server PLI when sync is required.

A few changes
- Run key frame requester goroutine always. Runs every 200 ms which is
  not bad.
- Post a key frame request when server knows it needs one, like after an
  allocation. This ensures that the initial request is not delayed.
- Periodic check will ensure PLI for cases like all frame chains of a
  dependency descriptor being broken.

* simplify

Update github.com/livekit/protocol digest to 07ca9d4

Generated by renovateBot

comment.body: Oops, I merged before coming that change. I will make another PR. Sorry.

pull_request.title: Do server PLI when sync is required.
pull_request.body:
A few changes
- Run key frame requester goroutine always. Runs every 200 ms which is not bad.
- Post a key frame request when server knows it needs one, like after an allocation. This ensures that the initial request is not delayed.
- Periodic check will ensure PLI for cases like all frame chains of a dependency descriptor being broken.

A few changes
- Run key frame requester goroutine always. Runs every 200 ms which is
  not bad.
- Post a key frame request when server knows it needs one, like after an
  allocation. This ensures that the initial request is not delayed.
- Periodic check will ensure PLI for cases like all frame chains of a
  dependency descriptor being broken.

* simplify

comment.body:
oh, you mean to say that all chains broken is  not needed? And just check for decodable? 

I think we can then change to `targetLayer`. The `requestSpatial` is an odd one. As `forwarder` allows overshooting (to deal with some clients that do not do layers properly), the target can be high, but request layer spatial refers to which layer the PLI request should be made on as all layers up to the target layer may not be available.

For SVC + DD, I think that is not important as it is single layer. So, we can change it to if decode target <= targetLayer is available, it should be good.

Let me make the change and attach diff here for your review.

comment.body: my bad, it is protected by forwarder lock so no race condition here. I would prefer to check decode target instead of decode chain as the target represents a special layer. If the `CheckSync` means there is a decodeable layer that is lesser or equal than the `RequestSpatial`, I think we don't need add extra check but just change the == to <= .

comment.body:
It is actually protected by `forwarder` lock, but let us not rely on that. Is it okay to protect with the `decodeTargets` lock?

Will make the change to check for <= (should be <= and not just < requestLayer, right?)

issue.title: Egress does not ACTIVE, sending plenty of PLI requests to publisher.
issue.body:
**Describe the bug**
We are using self-hosted Livekit server deployed on kubernetes clusters. We have problem when using Egress to record a participant's stream. Egress sometimes successfully record the video but most of the time it fails.

**Server**
- Version: 1.4.5
- Egress versions: 1.7.9
- Environment: EKS

<details>
  <summary>LiveKit server config</summary>  

```yaml
prometheus_port: 6789
  log_level: debug
  rtc:
    use_external_ip: false
    turn_servers:
      - host: ...
        port: 3478
        # tls, tcp, or udp
        protocol: udp
        username: ...
        credential: ...
  redis:
    address: :6379
    password: ...
  keys:
    ...
  turn:
    enabled: false
    # domain: <turn-address>
    # tls_port: 3478
    # secretName: <turn-tls-secret>
  egress:
    # Whether to use the PSRPC enabled RPC implementation. This requires livekit egress version >=1.5.4
    # The legacy, non PSRPC RPC implementation will be removed eventually
    use_psrpc: false
  webhook:
    # the API key to use in order to sign the message
    # this must match one of the keys LiveKit is configured with  
    api_key: $LIVEKIT_ID
    urls:
      - ...
  room:
    enabled_codecs:
      - mime: video/vp8
      - mime: audio/opus
      - mime: audio/red
```
</details>

<details>  
  <summary>Egress service config</summary>  

  ```yaml
  # required fields
  api_key: ...
  api_secret: ...
  ws_url: wss://...
  redis:
    address: :6379
    password: ...
  # optional fields
  log_level: debug
  health_port: 8080
  prometheus_port: 9090
  insecure: true
  cpu_cost: # optionally override cpu cost estimation, used when accepting or denying requests
    room_composite_cpu_cost: 2.5
    web_cpu_cost: 2.5
    track_composite_cpu_cost: 1
    track_cpu_cost: 0.5
  # file upload config - only one of the following. Can be overridden per-request
  gcp:
    bucket: ...
  ```
</details>
  
**Client**
- SDK: iOS
- Version: 1.0.13

<details>  
  <summary>iOS client config</summary>  

  ```swift
  let room = Room(delegate: self)

  let rtcConfig = RTCConfiguration()
  rtcConfig.iceTransportPolicy = .relay
  let options = ConnectOptions(rtcConfiguration: rtcConfig)
  
  var simulcastLayers = [VideoParameters]()
  var encoding = VideoParameters.presetH720_169.encoding
  var dimension = VideoParameters.presetH720_169.dimensions
  if let config = self.config {
      encoding = VideoEncoding(maxBitrate: config.bitrate, maxFps: 30)

      let simulcastKeys = config.simulcastLayers
      for key in simulcastKeys {
          let layer: VideoParameters
          switch (key) {
          case "h180":
              layer = .init(dimensions: .h180_169, encoding: encoding)
              break;
          case "h360":
              layer = .init(dimensions: .h360_169, encoding: encoding)
              break;
          case "h1080":
              layer = .init(dimensions: .h1080_169, encoding: encoding)
              break;
          default:
              layer = .init(dimensions: .h720_169, encoding: encoding)
              break
          }
          simulcastLayers.append(layer)
      }
      let highest = simulcastLayers.sorted(by: { first, second in
          return first.dimensions.height < second.dimensions.height
      }).first

      if let highest = highest {
          dimension = highest.dimensions
      }
  }
  
  let roomOptions = RoomOptions(
            defaultCameraCaptureOptions: .init(position: cameraPosition,
                                               dimensions: dimension
                                              ),
            defaultVideoPublishOptions: .init(encoding: encoding,
                                              simulcast: simulcastLayers.count > 1,
                                              simulcastLayers: simulcastLayers
                                             )
        )

  room.connect(url, token, connectOptions: options, roomOptions: roomOptions)
  ```

</details>

**To Reproduce**  
Steps to reproduce the behavior:
1. Participant A join room 1.
1. Backend server wait for track publish events of Participant A to request start an Egress.
1. Starting Egress by calling StartTrackCompositeEgress with Participant A video and audio track id, output type is segments.
1. Backend server stop the Egress. The Egress status is `ABORTED`.

**Expected behavior**
Egress records successfully.

**Screenshots**

**Additional context**
We did have the server logs but it's too long so I cannot paste it here.  
From the logs, we saw a message indicates `videolayerselector/simulcast` tried to upgrade the layer but resulting rolling back afterwards.

```
08:08:48.657Z	DEBUG	livekit.sub	videolayerselector/simulcast.go:51	upgrading layer	{"room": "5dabd19e-c353-4784-9738-92fa06a93605", "roomID": "RM_i4CDBipMZbkw", "participant": "EG_C8rfKr5T9c7W", "pID": "PA_YKuitaEojwMS", "remote": false, "trackID": "TR_VC7VYYX8JwH7AF", "relayed": false, "previous": "VideoLayer{s: -1, t: -1}", "current": "VideoLayer{s: 0, t: 0}", "previousTarget": "VideoLayer{s: 0, t: 3}", "target": "VideoLayer{s: 0, t: 3}", "max": "VideoLayer{s: 0, t: 3}", "layer": 0, "req": 0, "maxSeen": "VideoLayer{s: 0, t: -1}", "feed": 2670240106}
08:08:48.657Z	DEBUG	livekit.sub	videolayerselector/base.go:129	rolling back	{"room": "5dabd19e-c353-4784-9738-92fa06a93605", "roomID": "RM_i4CDBipMZbkw", "participant": "EG_C8rfKr5T9c7W", "pID": "PA_YKuitaEojwMS", "remote": false, "trackID": "TR_VC7VYYX8JwH7AF", "relayed": false, "previous": "VideoLayer{s: -1, t: -1}", "current": "VideoLayer{s: 0, t: 0}", "previousTarget": "VideoLayer{s: 0, t: 3}", "target": "VideoLayer{s: 0, t: 3}", "max": "VideoLayer{s: 0, t: 3}", "req": 0, "maxSeen": "VideoLayer{s: 0, t: -1}"}
```
  
Then there is a series of `sending PLI for layer lock` message.
```
08:08:48.660Z	DEBUG	livekit.sub	sfu/downtrack.go:603	sending PLI for layer lock	{"room": "5dabd19e-c353-4784-9738-92fa06a93605", "roomID": "RM_i4CDBipMZbkw", "participant": "EG_C8rfKr5T9c7W", "pID": "PA_YKuitaEojwMS", "remote": false, "trackID": "TR_VC7VYYX8JwH7AF", "relayed": false, "generation": 2, "layer": 0}
```
  
What should we do in this case to make the Egress start properly.

Thanks.

comment.body:
Hi @giovankabisano, we have updated our Livekit version to 1.5.0 and are observing the issue.
So far, everything is good.
We will be observing in the next week and will update the status later then.
